What is the annual percent yield (annual percent increase)?

solution.p: The initial amount is the coefficient 3700, because when \displaystyle{t}={0} the other factor is just one.

To calculate the annual percent increase we need to convert to the form \displaystyle{\left({1}+{p}\right)}^{{t}}. We can do this by \displaystyle{\left({1}+\frac{{0.0391}}{{12}}\right)}^{{{12}{t}}}={\left({\left({1}+\frac{{0.0391}}{{12}}\right)}^{{{12}}}\right)}^{{t}}={1.0398083710996}^{{t}}. Thus the percent increase is \displaystyle{1.0398083710996}-{1}={0.039808371099618} which in percent form is \displaystyle{100}{\left({0.039808371099618}\right)}={3.9808371099618}\%.
